/.abstract: Nintendo Switch game reviews and other writing from the keyboard of Bobby Jack
/.name: bobbyjack.me: Bobby Jack’s game reviews and other writing

/2020/06/12/all-nintendo-switch-games.abstract: This is a list of all Nintendo Switch games that I’ve played, in approximate order of preference.
/2020/06/12/all-nintendo-switch-games.name: All Nintendo Switch games

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Patrick’s Parabox
itemReviewed.reviewBody: A genuinely innovative take on the 2d puzzler produces a very solid concept which will live or die on level design.

itemReviewed.name: Pixboy
itemReviewed.reviewBody: A retro platformer with enough modern touches to make it wonderfully playable

itemReviewed.name: The Adventures of Elena Temple
itemReviewed.reviewBody: A game steeped in nostalgia that will delight old-timers but frustrate modern gamers

/2020/06/05/elena-temple.name: Review: The Adventures of Elena Temple

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Not Not
itemReviewed.reviewBody: Not Not is a fast-paced, fun, addictive brain teaser with enough content to kill a couple of hours.

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Coloring Book
itemReviewed.reviewBody: A bare-bones coloring book app that’s worth its asking price

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Pocket Mini Golf
itemReviewed.reviewBody: A reasonable game of mini golf somewhat spoiled by unorthodox progression.

/2020/08/30/pocket-mini-golf.name: One Hour Review: Pocket Mini Golf

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Robonauts
itemReviewed.reviewBody: Robonauts is a basic, but fun, shooter/platformer. It’s a welcome genre combination, and the interplanetary travel adds a lot of depth.

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Mini Trains
itemReviewed.reviewBody: Although it’s fairly playable, Mini Trains bolts on too many unnecessary features at the expense of its core gameplay.

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Jumping Joe & Friends
itemReviewed.reviewBody: A cheery, mindless game that reduces platforming to its absolute minimum.

/2020/08/29/jumping-joe-and-friends.name: One Hour Review: Jumping Joe & Friends

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Puzzle Book
itemReviewed.reviewBody: Puzzle Book is a decent jigsaw puzzle simulator, although it doesn't have a big list of features — or puzzles.

/2020/09/24/writing.abstract: This is a collection of links to various writing I have produced
/2020/09/24/writing.name: Writing by Bobby Jack

itemReviewed.name: A review of Spiritfarer on [bobbyjack.me]
itemReviewed.reviewBody: Spiritfarer is a captivating game with exploration, crafting, and platforming elements, woven around the moving stories of its characters.

itemReviewed.name: A review of Ministry of Broadcast on bobbyjack.me
itemReviewed.reviewBody: Big Brother meets … Big Brother. In this pixellated tale of dystopian reality game show, you’re tasked with completing a series of platforming puzzles — by fair means or foul.

/2020/10/27/ministry-of-broadcast.name: A review of Ministry of Broadcast on bobbyjack.me

itemReviewed.name: Yoku’s Island Express
itemReviewed.reviewBody: Yoku’s Island Express is a bewitching combination of arcade pinball mechanics and enchanting metroidvania. But is it more than the sum of its parts, or does the gimmick result in a game which falls short of the two genres’ potential?

/2020/02/18/yokus-island-express.abstract: Yoku’s Island Express: the ten most important things you need to know
/2020/02/18/yokus-island-express.name: Switch Notes: Yoku’s Island Express

/2020/02/18/switch-notes.abstract: A series of notes which summarise a game in ten points I consider most important.
/2020/02/18/switch-notes.name: Switch Notes

/2020/05/13/animal-crossing-new-horizons.abstract: Animal Crossing is compelling and frustrating, a modern day doll’s house with too little to do, that will probably still have you coming back time and time again.
/2020/05/13/animal-crossing-new-horizons.name: Review: Animal Crossing: New Horizons

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Tiny Fragments
itemReviewed.reviewBody: A simple-concept puzzler with plenty of possibilities

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Lola - The Escape Demo
itemReviewed.reviewBody: A bitesize adventure platformer with lots of character

/2020/03/07/lola-the-escape.name: One Hour Review: Lola - The Escape Demo

/2020/03/16/all-switch-purchases.abstract: This is a list of all Nintendo Switch games that I’ve paid actual, cold, hard money for.
/2020/03/16/all-switch-purchases.name: Bobby Jack’s Nintendo Switch Purchases

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Welcome to Elk Demo
itemReviewed.reviewBody: An engaging storyline and memorable characters liven up this short demo

/2020/03/20/welcome-to-elk.name: One Hour Review: Welcome to Elk Demo

/2020/03/02/twitter.abstract: A welcoming page for visitors from Twitter
/2020/03/02/twitter.name: Twitter

itemReviewed.name: Fez
itemReviewed.reviewBody: Fez is the kind of game with enough background to fill a review before gameplay has even been touched on.

itemReviewed.name: A review of Xeodrifter by Bobby Jack
itemReviewed.reviewBody: This Metroidvania is minimal in every way, but manages to deliver a great gameplay experience by focussing on the essentials.

/2021/02/06/xeodrifter.name: A review of Xeodrifter by Bobby Jack

/2019/12/31/best-of-2019.abstract: My personal round-up of the gaming year
/2019/12/31/best-of-2019.name: Best of 2019

itemReviewed.name: Gato Roboto
itemReviewed.reviewBody: Gato Roboto is adorable, and ideally suited to nostalgic handheld play, but — cute graphics aside — fails to be really memorable

itemReviewed.name: Kid Tripp
itemReviewed.reviewBody: Despite an aversion for auto-runners, I found Kid Tripp enjoyable, if on the short side.

/2019/08/09/in-development.abstract: A semi-regular series looking at video games in early development
/2019/08/09/in-development.name: Games in development

/2019/09/01/box-align.abstract: Box align is a 3d game stuck in a 2d world. Its core mechanic suffers as a result, and it doesn’t have enough redeeming features to make up for it.
/2019/09/01/box-align.name: Review: Box Align

/2019/09/18/about-stealthtacks.abstract: Stealthtacks is a minimalist Pinboard client. It’s an alternative to using pinboard.in or a browser-extension. You can use the public instance directly or download the code and host it yourself.
/2019/09/18/about-stealthtacks.name: About Stealthtacks

/2019/09/05/baba-is-you.abstract: Baba is game. Mechanics are modifiable. Game is fun and challenging.
/2019/09/05/baba-is-you.name: Review: Baba Is You

itemReviewed.name: Celeste
itemReviewed.reviewBody: Celeste answers the question ‘how can you make a plot really work in a video game?’. It’s a question we should all be asking more often, particularly when this is the answer.

/2019/10/22/lunar-station.abstract: An unnerving experience makes this atmospheric ‘short’ fresh & fun
/2019/10/22/lunar-station.name: One Hour Review: Lunar Station

/2019/10/23/baby-dino-adventures.abstract: A highly-promising bundle of classic platforming fun
/2019/10/23/baby-dino-adventures.name: One Hour Review: Baby Dino Adventures

/2019/10/24/twitter.abstract: A welcoming page for visitors from Twitter
/2019/10/24/twitter.name: Twitter

/2019/10/06/yellow-fins-demo.abstract: Yellow Fins looks OK, but it’s just a mobile game with very little appeal, and the demo does it no favours at all.
/2019/10/06/yellow-fins-demo.name: Review: Yellow Fins Demo

/2019/10/31/gum-girl.abstract: Gum Girl is a very solid platformer with a fun and powerful central mechanic
/2019/10/31/gum-girl.name: One Hour Review: Gum Girl

/2019/10/07/ori-and-the-blind-forest-dem.abstract: Gorgeous audio/visuals and a promising adventure, but I end up on the fence
/2019/10/07/ori-and-the-blind-forest-dem.name: One Hour Review: Ori and the Blind Forest Demo

/2019/10/07/strikey-sisters-demo.abstract: A simple twist on a classic concept, with plenty of content in the demo
/2019/10/07/strikey-sisters-demo.name: One Hour Review: Strikey Sisters Demo

/2019/10/26/super-box-land-demake.abstract: This great-looking Sokoban-like has some excellent levels, but too few of them
/2019/10/26/super-box-land-demake.name: Review: Super Box Land Demake

/2019/10/11/reap.abstract: This small game distills the essence of the survival genre with some highly inventive mechanics.
/2019/10/11/reap.name: One Hour Review: Reap

/2019/10/18/lingth.abstract: Introducing lingth, a simple line-length checker
/2019/10/18/lingth.name: lingth

/2019/10/18/about-1derlust.abstract: 1derlust is a game. A rather silly one, certainly; and incredibly simple one, undoubtedly — I’ve described it as making “Pong look like Breath of the Wild”, which is only a small exaggeration. But, nevertheless, it is a game.
/2019/10/18/about-1derlust.name: About 1derlust

/2019/11/12/mystical-samurai.abstract: This is a real joy, a retro title done so well that it’s slightly cruel it’s not a full game!
/2019/11/12/mystical-samurai.name: One Hour Review: Mystical Samurai

/2019/11/08/card-hog.abstract: Perfect for mobile, but with added depth than that implies, Card Hog plays great and is evolving fast!
/2019/11/08/card-hog.name: One Hour Review: Card Hog

/2019/11/16/garden-story.abstract: For a game that contains so many different elements, this demo teases just enough to have me begging for more
/2019/11/16/garden-story.name: One Hour Review: Garden Story Demo

/2019/11/16/baba-is-you.abstract: Baba Is You: the ten most important things you need to know
/2019/11/16/baba-is-you.name: Switch Notes: Baba Is You

/2019/05/14/ding-dong-xl.abstract: Ding Dong XL couldn’t be simpler, so it’s hard to love, but easy to enjoy
/2019/05/14/ding-dong-xl.name: Review: Ding Dong XL

/2019/05/13/golf-story.abstract: A quirky combination of sports game and RPG produces a highly original and entertaining result
/2019/05/13/golf-story.name: Review: Golf Story

/2019/05/17/the-way-remastered.abstract: The Way Remastered has some problems, but it pays homage to a certain style of challenging action platformer very well indeed
/2019/05/17/the-way-remastered.name: Review: The Way Remastered

/2019/05/03/dig-dog.abstract: Dig Dog is a fast-paced, perfectly-pitched rogue-lite, offering an addictive slice of nostalgia
/2019/05/03/dig-dog.name: Review: Dig Dog

/2019/04/11/the-flame-in-the-flood.name: Review: The Flame in the Flood

itemReviewed.name: One Hour Review: Mimic
itemReviewed.reviewBody: An inventive twist on the tile-pushing genre.
